diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Both patients were elderly and taking ACE inhibitors, presenting with dyspnea and exhibiting laboratory findings indicative of hyperkalemic metabolic acidosis. The distinguishing factor was the presence of elevated potassium levels and acidosis without gastrointestinal losses, leading to the diagnosis of type IV RTA. Initial misdiagnoses included CHF and asthma exacerbation, but the resolution of symptoms with treatment for RTA confirmed the diagnosis.
